title: Bob Marley and the Wailers - Quiet Knight Club, Chicago, USA - J
description:
Bob Marley - Rastafarian USA 

Source:Soundboard or RadioBroadcast  / Mp3 256 mbit/s
Place: Quiet Knight Club,Chicago,Illinois, USA.  June 10th 1975 (Second night at the Quiet Knight Club)
Recorde live exlusive for the "Budweiser sunday night concert" on 93 XRT radio chicago.

Various bootlegs of this show have been released, like "Jah Joys And Rainbows", "Live In Chicago" "Downtown Trenchtown" or "The Last Club Tour '75", and has also been aired on various radio stations.


Tracklist:
01_Slave driver - Bob Marley & The Wailers   04:23
02_Trenchtown Rock - Bob Marley & The Wailers   05:56
03_Concrete Jungle - Bob Marley & The Wailers   06:02
04_Midnight Raver - Bob Marley & The Wailers   06:36
05_Talkin' Blues - Bob Marley & The Wailers   06:06
06_Rebel Music - Bob Marley & The Wailers   07:32
07_I Shot The Sheriff - Bob Marley & The Wailers*   12:22
08_Natty Dread - Bob Marley & The Wailers   08:15
Runningtime: 57:14 min
* Band introduction done by Bob Marley during "I Shot The Sheriff". 

Lineup:
Bob Marley - Lead Vocal
Al Anderson - Lead Guitar
Aston "Family Man" Barrett - Bass
Carlton Barrett - Drums
Tyrone Downie - Keyboards
Alvin "Seeco" Patterson - Percussion
Lee Jaffe -  harmonica*
The "I Threes":
Judy Mowatt - Backup Vocals
Marcia Griffiths - Backup Vocals**
Rita Marley - Backup Vocals
*Bob don't introduce him.
**Bob don't introduce her, so it is possible that she dident singing on that gig.
